channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report E-2023120233
item.description:
Report E-2023120233

  • City: KEARNY

  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, (1) -(4.5) gal plastic pail was crushed, due to no dunnage inside the trailer. (1/2) gal of material was released.

item.title: Report X-2023120674
item.description:
Report X-2023120674

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: WAYNE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE UNLOADED AND BROUGHT TO QA DUE TO STRONG SMELL. 3 INNER BOXES PACKED SIDEWAYS INSIDE ONE LARGER BOX. DescribePack: 4 OF 6 1.5L SPRAY BOTTLES LEAKED - NO LONGER LEAKING WHEN TIPPED FOR QA INSPECTION. ONE CAP HAD PIECE CRACKED OFF. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IMMEDIATELY INTO PLASTIC LINED HAZMAT TOTE, ZIP TIED AND CLOSED. PLACED INTO HAZMAT AREA IN REAR OF BUILDING.

item.title: Report X-2023120393

Report X-2023120393

  • City: WAYNE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE UNLOADED FROM TRAILER AND PLACED ON ROLLERS AWAITING MANUAL TRANSPORT TO VAN LINE. PKG HANDLER NOTICED LEAKING AND CALLED QA. DescribePack: SMALL PUNCTURE AT BOTTOM RIM OF PLASTIC CYLINDER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN ABSORBANT-PAD LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND REMOVED FROM AREA. PLACED IN VENTILATED HAZMAT CAGE AT REAR OF BLDG.

item.title: Report X-2023120389
item.description:
Report X-2023120389

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION ONE OF FOUR BOTTLE OF ZEP OVEN BRITE WAS FOUND TO BE FULLY LEAKED OUT AND TWO ALSO MISSING. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ZEP OVEN BRITE PACKAGE CAUSED FROM IT BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 20 and MitigateEffect: REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023120363
item.description:
Report X-2023120363

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120363 SequenceEvent: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with wet conditions and ripped conditions. Upon inspection, 1 of 4 bottles were found with a missing cap causing all the liquid to leak out. The package was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a loose cap that went missing, causing the entire gallon to leak out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were placed upright into a salvage drum and caps were secured tight. 2. X-2023120388 SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION ONE OF FOUR BOTTLE OF RAPICIDE WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKED OUT. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE RAPICIDE PACKAGE CAUSED FROM IT BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023120355
item.description:
Report X-2023120355

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage in wet conditions and with openings opened. Upon inspection 1 of 2 bottles containing "Diversey R2 Hygienic Hard Surface Cleaner" were found to have leaked out about a tablespoon of the liquid. Bottles have a inner plug cap but seem to have had a outer cap which is missing on both bottles. Package was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure seems to be from a outer cap missing on both bottles. 1 of 2 of the plastic bottles leaked out about a tablespoon of liquid from the cap area. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were placed upright into a lined salvage drum to await disposition.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during the sunrise sort, in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection of "MEDIVATORS RAPICIDE PA" showed package to be wet, from internal leakage, and torn open, with evidence of being upside down. Damage most likely caused from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a plastic salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2023120430
item.description:
Report X-2023120430

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon inspection there are four plastic 4 Liter bottles of ColorWright Wright-Giemsa stain inside the fiberboard box. Two of the plastic four-liter bottles have cracks on the seam by the handle causing the liquid to leak throughout the fiberboard box. The box is stained from purple liquid. DescribePack: The seams on the two plastic bottles of ColorWright Wright-Giemsa Stain cracked. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Plastic bottles were placed inside hazardous material plastic bags.

item.title: Report E-2023120246
item.description:
Report E-2023120246

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-20T18:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: FAIRFIELD
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As our driver was making a pickup at a customer location, the customer was loading their freight into our trailer using a forklift. As they were loading a skid, the operator's forks punctured two steel drums already loaded on our trailer from a previous pickup. The majority of the released material was contained to the trailer floor. A professional spill response contractor was called to the scene to contain and remediate all of the released material and overpacked the damaged drums. All released material was containerized for proper disposal. The package specifications were not able to be obtained.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON ON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE OF FOUR ADVANTAGE CHEMICALS DELIMER WAS FOUND SLIGTY LEAKING AND TWO MISSING. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ADVANTAGE CHEMICALS DELIMER CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION UNLESS OTHERWISE.

item.title: Report E-2023120208
item.description:
Report E-2023120208

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a one-gallon spill of regulated UN1219 "Isopropanol 99%" that arrived damaged at Terminal XNJ. (1) a one-gallon metal pail was damaged due to freight impact as a result of a load shift impacting Trailer. The SDS with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. A (1) 10-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material used, the damaged pail, the remaining material, and issued PPE was created onsite and left for the terminal to manage.

Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: Shipping box crushed and punctured while in transit causing one of six Sunnyside Denatured Alcohol 1Gal cans to become crushed and one of six to become crushed. item.title: Report X-2023120261
item.description:
Report X-2023120261

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: WAYNE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Once the driver pulled into the station, he informed station personnel regarding the hazmat spillage incident. He informed us that there was a screw sticking out from the bottom of the back of his van door. He stated that the screw must have punctured the package as he ran over a bump. Station personnel equipped themselves with PPE and removed the package from the van. In house cleanup proceeded. DescribePack: The hole produced was about the size of a dime, located at the bottom of the jerrican's body DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Oil absorbent as well as absorbent pads were used to cleanup the remaining liquid.

UPON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE OF ZEP ACIDIC TOILET BOWEL CLEANER WAS FOUND WITH THE CAP OFF WHICH CAUSED IT TO LEAK. item.title: Report X-2023120130
item.description:
Report X-2023120130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage wet with what seems like paint. Upon inspection 1 paint can was found bubble wrapped with the paint cap popped opened and the paint spilled. Paint can did not contain clips. Package was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a semi open paint can lid, due to not being properly closed and sealed with paint clips. Paint can leaked out entirely due to the open lid. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed into a salvage drum upon arrival at the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023120105
item.description:
Report X-2023120105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-24
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION 3 OF 4 BOTTLES OF ACETONE FOUND CRACKED AND FULLY LEAKED OUT. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILUE OF THE PACKAGE CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING MISHANDLED OR DROPPED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE HURRIDLY PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE.

item.title: Report E-2023120065
item.description:
Report E-2023120065

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: LAKEWOOD
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-30ft area of the asphalt/concrete parking lot, the trailer floor and concrete dock floor and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Enviroserve personnel gravity transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote and the damaged tote was cut-up and placed into one 55-gallon poly drum. The new 275-gallon poly tote was shipped on to the consignee. Enviroserve personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted areas and then used a granular absorbent to gather the spent material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120062
item.description:
Report E-2023120062

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: NORTH BERGEN
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-53ft area of the trailer floor and 2ft-by-2ft area of the asphalt terminal lot under the trailer and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to one (1) damaged/leaking 55-gallon metal drum that had been punctured by other freight. First Call Environmental personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and then wiped down all impacted packaged in the trailer with rags. The spent absorbents were gathered and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged 55- gallon metal drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
